item.description:
To encourage new people to join the group and come to the meetings we are going to add a short presentation and FREE STUFF* to the meetings.

* Free stuff will appear whenever an anonymous benefactor provides it. This month there will be stepper motors.

 

Meeting plan

  • Wait a while for people to arrive
  • The presentation about using motors with Arduino
  • Free stuff
  • The part where you volunteer to present stuff you made
  • Open questions/answers

 

Directions

The meetup is at Microsoft New England Research & Development Center (NERD) near MIT in cambridge.  http://microsoftcambridge.com/About/Directions/tabid/89/Default.aspx

The easiest way to get to NERD is to take the T to MIT/Kendall and walk down Main St to NERD and then around the side of the building to the front doors (marked with red arrows on the map)  Parking is available on Main St ($1/hr, free after ?), some MIT lots (check the signs), and in the parking garage at NERD (listed as $10).  There will be a receptionist at the desk in the main lobby with a sheet of paper labeled "Arduino meetup" or something similar and they will usually ask you to sign it.  They will tell you to take the elevator to the first floor where you will find the doors for Microsoft Research and another receptionist.  They can give you directions to the actual room we are in since it seems to get changed a lot.
item.name: Arduino Users Group Meeting
